decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents: HR/ND/00; HR/ND/02; HR/ND/03; HR/ND/04; HR/ND/05; HR/ND/06; HR/ND/13; HR/ND/14; HR/N/15; HR/ND/16; HR/ND/17; HR/ND/18; HR/ND/19; ND/LM/0016; LR/ND/117.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall match those described in the approved drawings and documents listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the special character of the Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and the Mount Park Conservation Area Management Plan. | Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shall be implemented in accordance with the submitted documentation and Council Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policy SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to first occupation, 9 covered and secured cycle parking spaces shall be implemented in the location shown on the approved plans and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate cycle storage, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to first occupation, the amenity spaces, hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatments shall be installed and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policy SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | Privacy screens shown on the approved drawings of condition 2 shall be installed prior to first use of the balconies and retained in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure neighbouring properties are not unduly impacted by a loss of privacy in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom/space above kitchen/living/dining room of separate flat and adjoining the communal main entrance. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan (2021). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Conversion of dwellinghouse into five self-contained flats, together landscaping, cycle and bin storage. Two storey side extension with mansard roof to provide accommodation in the roof space incorporating side and rear dormer windows; single storey rear and rear/side infill  extension (following removal of existing garage and outbuilding) approved under application ref. 222106HH.
